DataElement.preferredDefinition: The final pathology result of the pancreatic duct communication type.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Ducts that collect pancreatic juice from thepancreas and supply it to the duodenum. (MeSH)_Conclusive in a process or progression._The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Ducts that collect pancreatic juice from thepancreas and supply it to the duodenum. (MeSH)

Concepts.definition: A duct joining the pancreas to the common bile duct to supply pancreatic juices.

Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

Concepts.definition: Conclusive in a process or progression.

The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Mixed Type Pancreatic Intraductal Papillary-Mucinous Neoplasm

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Mixed Type Pancreatic Intraductal Papillary-Mucinous Neoplasm
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An intraductal papillary-mucinous neoplasm of the pancreas that arises primarily from the main pancreatic duct and extends to the branch ducts.

Concepts.longName: Mixed Type Pancreatic Intraductal Papillary-Mucinous Neoplasm
Concepts.definition: An intraductal papillary-mucinous neoplasm of the pancreas that arises primarily from the main pancreatic duct and extends to the branch ducts.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Main Duct Pancreatic Intraductal Papillary-Mucinous Neoplasm

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Main Duct Pancreatic Intraductal Papillary-Mucinous Neoplasm
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An intraductal papillary-mucinous neoplasm of the pancreas that arises from the main pancreatic duct.

Concepts.longName: Main Duct Pancreatic Intraductal Papillary-Mucinous Neoplasm
Concepts.definition: An intraductal papillary-mucinous neoplasm of the pancreas that arises from the main pancreatic duct.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Branch Duct Pancreatic Intraductal Papillary-Mucinous Neoplasm

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Branch Duct Pancreatic Intraductal Papillary-Mucinous Neoplasm
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An intraductal papillary-mucinous neoplasm of the pancreas that arises in one of the branches of the main pancreatic duct.  It usually has an indolent behavior.

Concepts.longName: Branch Duct Pancreatic Intraductal Papillary-Mucinous Neoplasm
Concepts.definition: An intraductal papillary-mucinous neoplasm of the pancreas that arises in one of the branches of the main pancreatic duct.  It usually has an indolent behavior.
